intro: Drimia undata subsp. caeculi, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of small, white to pale purple flowers. The plant is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance. Botanically, it belongs to the Asparagaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with similar growth habits.
